intro: Hieracium nobile subsp. burserianum, commonly known as the noble hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by elongated, petal-like bracts. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks.
